title: How to access tabular data in Elmer with `psrcelmer`.
text: datasets within Elmer stored tables, static sets records. Although shape format tables designed speed data retrieval, always intuitively obvious formats users consume. cases, views, better data sets pull R tables . Views essentially stored queries within Elmer reshape present data sets way

what: Let’s make a fancier looking map with PSRC colors using Census Data
title: Create a Fancier Map with ElmerGeo Data, PSRC Colors, and Census data
text: vignette Create Map ElmerGeo Data, showed make simple leaflet map ElmerGeo data. want make complex map? example, going use homegrown libraries- psrccensus psrcplot- make map Census data using PSRC colors. map show usually working home commute shares Census Tract 5-year ACS 2017-2021 dataset. (doesn’t include workers occasionally work home.) make fancier map, need libraries. use psrccensus need api key, see page info.

what: Function to make a map of telecommuting by tract
title: Create a Fancier Map with ElmerGeo Data, PSRC Colors, and Census data
text: function make map telecommuting tract. need set data first can run , .
code:
create_tract_map_telecommute <- function(census.tbl, census.lyr, map.title = NULL, map.subtitle = NULL, map.title.position = "topright", legend.title = NULL, legend.subtitle = NULL, map.lat=47.615, map.lon=-122.257, map.zoom=8.5, wgs84=4326){ tbl <- census.tbl c.layer <- dplyr::left_join(census.lyr,census.tbl, by = c('geoid20'='GEOID')) %>% sf::st_transform(wgs84) color.ramp <- colorRamp(psrcplot::psrc_colors$purples_inc, interpolate="spline") pal <- leaflet::colorNumeric(palette=color.ramp, domain = c.layer$work_at_home_share) labels <- paste0( "Work at Home Share: ", percent(c.layer$work_at_home_share, accuracy=1)) %>% lapply(htmltools::HTML) m <- leaflet::leaflet() %>% leaflet::addMapPane(name = "polygons", zIndex = 410) %>% leaflet::addMapPane(name = "maplabels", zIndex = 500) %>% leaflet::addProviderTiles("CartoDB.VoyagerNoLabels") %>% leaflet::addProviderTiles("CartoDB.VoyagerOnlyLabels", options = leaflet::leafletOptions(pane = "maplabels"), group = "Labels") %>% leaflet::addEasyButton(leaflet::easyButton(icon="fa-globe", title="Region", onClick=leaflet::JS("function(btn, map) {map.setView([47.615,-122.257],8.5); }"))) %>% leaflet::addPolygons(data=c.layer, fillOpacity = 0.9, fillColor = pal(c.layer$work_at_home_share), weight = 0.7, color = "#BCBEC0", group="Population", opacity = 0, stroke=FALSE, options = leaflet::leafletOptions(pane = "polygons"), dashArray = "", highlight = leaflet::highlightOptions( weight =5, color = "76787A", dashArray ="", fillOpacity = 0.9, bringToFront = TRUE), label = labels, labelOptions = leaflet::labelOptions( style = list("font-weight" = "normal", padding = "3px 8px"), textsize = "15px", direction = "auto", font="Poppins")) %>% leaflet::addLegend(pal = pal, values = c.layer$work_at_home_share, labFormat = labelFormat( suffix = "%", transform = function(x) 100 * x ), position = "bottomright", title = paste(legend.title, '
', legend.subtitle)) %>% leaflet::addLayersControl(baseGroups = "CartoDB.PositronNoLabels", overlayGroups = c("Labels", "Population")) %>% leaflet::setView(lng=map.lon, lat=map.lat, zoom=map.zoom) return(m) }

previous_headings: Function to make a map of telecommuting by tract
what: Get the Census data and format it to use with a map
title: Create a Fancier Map with ElmerGeo Data, PSRC Colors, and Census data
text: step gets commute mode totals tract mode using psrccensus. calculate work shares work home total divided total workers. Now can use psrcelmer package read 2020 Tract Layer. Now data create map. want make similar maps, can modify function code deal specifics datasets. ’s call function make map: ’s map looks:
code: mode_to_work <- psrccensus::get_acs_recs(geography='tract',                 table.names=c('B08006'),years=c(2021)) #> Getting data from the 2017-2021 5-year ACS #> Loading ACS5 variables for 2021 from table B08006. To cache this dataset for faster access to ACS tables in the future, run this function with `cache_table = TRUE`. You only need to do this once per ACS dataset. all_workers_tract<-mode_to_work%>%   filter(label=='Estimate!!Total:') home_workers_tract<-mode_to_work%>%   filter(label=='Estimate!!Total:!!Worked from home')  home_workers_join<-merge(all_workers_tract, home_workers_tract, by= 'GEOID',                           suffixes=c('_all', '_home')) home_workers_share<- home_workers_join%>%   mutate(work_at_home_share=estimate_home/estimate_all) tract.lyr<-st_read_elmergeo('TRACT2020_NOWATER') telecommute_share_map<-create_tract_map_telecommute(home_workers_share, tract.lyr) telecommute_share_map

title: Create a Map Basic with ElmerGeo Data
text: Leaflet popular open-source JavaScript library interactive maps. R package leaflet makes easy integrate control Leaflet maps R. Leaflet maps can made display spatial data one simple-feature (sf) layers.

title: Create a Map Basic with ElmerGeo Data
text: SF stands “simple features”, standardized way encoding spatial data. R, spatial datasets typically stored sf objects.

what: So how do I make a map?
title: Create a Map Basic with ElmerGeo Data
text: can make simple map essentially two steps (three count loading libraries). example create layer county polygons COUNTY_BACKGROUND feature class ElmerGeo. Create layer create sf layer feature class ElmerGeo, using st_read_elmergeo() function: Display layer leaflet map. creates map simple styling. can learn enhance aesthetics leaflet documentation. using RStudio map automatically rendered viewer pane.

what: Provides streamlined methods to retrieve data from PSRC's databases Elmer and ElmerGeo.
title: Provides streamlined methods to retrieve data from PSRC's databases Elmer and ElmerGeo.
text: R utilities interacting Elmer ElmerGeo package provides single-line tools retrieve data sets PSRC’s data warehouse databases Elmer ElmerGeo.

title: Provides streamlined methods to retrieve data from PSRC's databases Elmer and ElmerGeo.
text: Elmer database containing agency’s general-use tabular data. constantly expanding contents, currently ranges demographic, employment, aviation, parking, survey data.

title: Provides streamlined methods to retrieve data from PSRC's databases Elmer and ElmerGeo.
text: ElmerGeo PSRC’s home geospatial data use staff. past used shapefiles spatial data, today store feature classes within geodatabase. PSRC, database use purpose named ElmerGeo.

title: Provides streamlined methods to retrieve data from PSRC's databases Elmer and ElmerGeo.
text: can install package following command: load :

title: Provides streamlined methods to retrieve data from PSRC's databases Elmer and ElmerGeo.
text: use package first need login SQL Server Sockeye (AWS-PROD-SQL\Sockeye). See agency’s staff need login questions . Windows machine, now need order connect retrieve data Elmer ElmerGeo. Windows account can authenticate seamlessly, without requiring supply another username password. Mac, Linux box TRS-80 need provide username password. , need set two environment variables computer. variables SOCKEYE_UID SOCKEYE_PWD. , SQL username “some_username” password “some_passwd”, set , R: set, able connect run functions package.

title: get_query(sql, db_name) — get_query
text: Retrieve dataset defined SQL string

title: get_query(sql, db_name) — get_query
text: sql String.  SQL command send <db_name>. db_name String.  name database run query .  "Elmer" "ElmerGeo".  Default = "Elmer".

title: get_query(sql, db_name) — get_query
text: data frame.

title: get_table(db_name, tbl_name) — get_table
text: Retrieve dataset defined table name.

title: get_table(db_name, tbl_name) — get_table
text: db_name String.  name database run query .  "Elmer" "ElmerGeo".  Default = "Elmer". schema String.  name schema table exists .  default. tbl_name String.  name table retrieved.  default.

title: get_table(db_name, tbl_name) — get_table
text: data frame.

title: get_table(db_name, tbl_name) — get_table
code: get_table(schema = 'chas', tbl_name = 'tenure_dim') #>   tenure_dim_id          created_at          updated_at #> 1             1 2021-01-08 14:47:29 2021-01-08 15:07:17 #> 2             2 2021-01-08 14:47:29 2021-01-08 15:07:17 #> 3             3 2021-01-08 14:47:29 2021-01-08 15:07:33 #>                     tenure_name tenure_order #> 1                Owner occupied            1 #> 2               Renter occupied            2 #> 3 Total: Occupied housing units            0

title: list_feature_classes(feature_dataset, feature_class) — list_feature_classes
text: list feature classes available ElmerGeo

title: list_feature_classes(feature_dataset, feature_class) — list_feature_classes
text: feature_dataset String.  supplied, filters list just feature classes feature dataset feature_class String.  supplied, filters list just named one.  can useful know name feature class geography type feature dataset resides .

title: list_feature_classes(feature_dataset, feature_class) — list_feature_classes
text: dataframe listing layer names along corresponding feature datasets geometry types..  Defaults NULL.

title: list_recordsets(schema_name, recordset_type) — list_recordsets
text: return list tables views available PSRC's -house data warehouse

title: list_recordsets(schema_name, recordset_type) — list_recordsets
text: schema_name (string, optional) supplied, limits returned list tables views schema_name. include_base_tables (TRUE|FALSE, optional) false, return views (tables).  False default.

text: list tables, form dataframe

what: psrcelmer: A package for easy retrieval of data from PSRC's databases Elmer and ElmerGeo — psrcelmer
title: psrcelmer: A package for easy retrieval of data from PSRC's databases Elmer and ElmerGeo — psrcelmer
text: Provides streamlined methods retrieve data PSRC's databases Elmer ElmerGeo.

title: psrcelmer: A package for easy retrieval of data from PSRC's databases Elmer and ElmerGeo — psrcelmer
text: Chris Peak cpeak@psrc.org Mike Jensen mjensen@psrc.org Homepage: https://psrc.github.io/psrcelmer/

title: st_read_elmergeo(layer_name, ...) — st_read_elmergeo
text: read simple features PSRC's -house geodatabase #' function preferable sf::st_read() pulling Elmer ElmerGeo, avoids incompatibilities SQL Server's data types R's.

title: st_read_elmergeo(layer_name, ...) — st_read_elmergeo
text: layer_name name feature layer geodatabase table schema_name name schema layer_name exists .  Defaults "dbo", standard schema ElmerGeo tables project_to_wgs84 (TRUE/FALSE) TRUE deliver output WGS84 projection, otherwise NAD84 / WA State Plane North.  Defaults TRUE.

title: st_read_elmergeo(layer_name, ...) — st_read_elmergeo
text: object class sf

title: st_read_elmergeo(layer_name, ...) — st_read_elmergeo
text: layer set ESRI versioned layer geodatabase, function returns versioned view (exists SQL Server "_evw" suffix).  set way, returns base table.
